climbs.name: Tuxedo
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Kelly Corcorran, & Ben Banks

content.description: Climbs up the vertical face past 3 bolts. I found the crux after 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor that is over the edge (ie not visible until you at at them).
content.location: Left of Ascot between Ascot and the dihederal.

climbs.name: Star Dust
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Kelly Corcorran, & Ben Banks

content.description: Climbs the steep wall over the bulge to thin holds to push thru to the finish.
content.location: Starts to the left of the large hueco.

climbs.name: Satin Shoes
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Ben Banks, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Satin Shoes climbs the steep slab located on the right edge of the right most (southern) formation.  Climb the run out face on a variety of positive edges past a hole near the top.
content.location: Satin Shoes is left right most route on the west face, at the right edge on the block.

climbs.name: Preakness
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Ben Banks, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Preakness climbs the steep face in the center of the west face on solid edges. Climb steep face on fine edges.
content.location: Center of the face, right of "Cavier."

climbs.name: Lush Life
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Ben Banks, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Lush Life climbs the face just right of the arete. Climb the featured face on positive edges left of "Satin Shoes" past 3 bolts.
content.location: Southern aspect of the face of the 1st formation encountered on the approach. 2nd route to the left.

climbs.name: High Ball
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Kelly Corcorran, & Ben Banks

content.description: High Ball climbs the steep arete on the right side of the formation. A difficult start leads to sustained 5.10 climbing up the arete left of the dihedral.
content.location: On the arete and face at the right edge of the face. Left of the dihedral.

climbs.name: Caviar
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, Kelly Corcorran, & Ben Banks

content.description: Begin in the shallow groove left of Preakness up continuous sidepulls until the route trends to the right for the final 15-20 feet up face climbing.
content.protection: 4 bolts (last bolt is shared with Preakness)
